alert.note: Alert for Boone (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 9:08PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Boone County through 945 PM CST... At 908 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Osage, or 15 miles southeast of Berryville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrison... Diamond City... Bergman... Lead Hill... Valley Springs... Olvey... Myrtle... Capps... Willis... Red Bank... Crawford... Winington... Bellefonte... Alpena... Everton... Zinc... South Lead Hill... Batavia... Bear Creek Springs... Hopewell in Boone County... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for north central Arkansas.
